page.title: 16THE SLAG BANK,WORKINGTON
page.content: The{slag bank is industrial waste}that has been tipped along the coast between Workington and Harrington,2.5 miles to the south. Part of it is within the{MOBET enterprise zone.}The development of the slag bank has pushed the{coastline seawards. The slag bank is made from waste called{silica}a by-product of the making of iron in the{blast furnaces. The last blast furnace closed down in 1981. The waste was piled up on top of {Chappel Hill}developing it to a height of{220 feet above sea level,}this is nearly 100 feet above the original height of Chappel Hill. Part of the MOBET scheme is to {reduce the slag bank}to it's original height and re-expose Chappel Hill. When this has been done they intend to {grass the area and plant trees}to make Workington's coastline more attractive
